traveler. The roads aren't safe anymore. I've even heard reports of dragons nearby.^

column3: I'd rather be on the front lines than babysitting.^

thanks in large part to the braghins. They've turned this quiet grove into a death trap.^

t_korean: ^Normally we could teleport straight to the capital
column3: but Lestin here tells me that the forest transit shrines have been deactivated. Sounds like we'll have to fight our way out.^

t_korean: ^The sooner we can reach the capital

but Brakarr Forest has its fair share of danger. The braghins don't cut down many trees
column4: but they sure like to go after our loggers...^

t_korean: ^The princess wields the power of Ellora. Perhaps Salant is fearful of that power.^

column3: we're ruined if we don't put out these flames.^

t_korean: ^Poor Princess Lania. She barely escaped from Duke Elder's plot
column3: just to run into the very descendant of the God of Ruin... Such a shame.^

t_korean: ^Princess Lania visited Brakarr Forest in secret once. She wanted to rally us soldiers fighting the braghins
column3: and that's just what she did.^

t_korean: ^The braghins came out of nowhere. The fact that the mustered so close to Hakain's Crossing is a mark against the Dragon Knights.^

column3: and let me tell you

column3: too

t_korean: ^Princess Lania brought peace to this treacherous place. After her visit

t_korean: ^Only Princess Lania was able to communicate with the ghosts of the ruins. If only she were here today...^

help me...^
